article:
The Batman (film)
================

The Batman is a 2022 superhero thriller film directed by Matt Reeves and produced by Reeves and Dylan Clark. The film is based on the DC Comics character of the same name and is a reboot of the Batman film franchise. The movie follows the story of Bruce Wayne, a.k.a. Batman, as he investigates a series of murders committed by the Riddler, a serial killer who targets the corrupt and wealthy elite of Gotham City.

Plot
-----

The film takes place two years after Bruce Wayne (Robert Pattinson) has become the vigilante Batman. He is still struggling to come to terms with the death of his parents and is obsessed with finding justice for the people of Gotham City. The story begins with the murder of the Gotham City Mayor, Don Mitchell Jr. (Rupert Penry-Jones), who is found dead in his mansion with a cryptic message left behind by the killer.

As Batman delves deeper into the case, he realizes that the murder is linked to a series of other killings, all of which have been committed by the Riddler (Paul Dano), a serial killer who uses his cleverness and intelligence to outsmart his victims and the police. The Riddler's modus operandi is to leave behind a series of clues and puzzles, which he believes will lead Batman to the truth about the corrupt and decadent society of Gotham City.

As Batman investigates the case, he is aided by his allies, including his butler Alfred Pennyworth (Andy Serkis), Commissioner James Gordon (Jeffrey Wright), and Selina Kyle (Zoë Kravitz), a cat burglar who becomes embroiled in the case. Together, they uncover a web of corruption and deceit that goes all the way to the top of Gotham City's power structure.

Cast
-----

* Robert Pattinson as Bruce Wayne / Batman
* Paul Dano as Edward Nashton / The Riddler
* Zoë Kravitz as Selina Kyle / Catwoman
* Jeffrey Wright as James Gordon
* John Turturro as Carmine Falcone
* Peter Sarsgaard as Gil Colson
* Andy Serkis as Alfred Pennyworth
* Colin Farrell as Oswald Cobblepot / The Penguin

Production
------------

### Development

#### Early work and initial plans from Ben Affleck

In 2014, it was announced that Ben Affleck would star in and direct a new Batman film, which would be part of the DC Extended Universe. The film was initially titled "The Batman" and was set to be released in 2018. However, in 2017, Affleck dropped out of the project, citing that he wanted to focus on acting.

#### Redevelopment under Matt Reeves

After Affleck's departure, the project was redeveloped under the direction of Matt Reeves, who was known for his work on the "Planet of the Apes" franchise. Reeves brought a new vision to the project, which would focus on a more grounded and realistic take on the Batman character. The film would also be a standalone story, separate from the DC Extended Universe.

### Writing

The screenplay for "The Batman" was written by Matt Reeves and Peter Craig. The story was inspired by the comic book series "The Long Halloween" and "The Killing Joke". The script was rewritten several times, with input from the cast and crew.

### Casting

Robert Pattinson was cast as Bruce Wayne / Batman in May 2019. The casting decision was met with some skepticism from fans, who were unsure if Pattinson was the right choice for the role. However, Reeves was confident in his choice, citing Pattinson's ability to bring a depth and nuance to the character.

The rest of the cast was announced over the next few months, including Paul Dano as the Riddler, Zoë Kravitz as Selina Kyle / Catwoman, and Jeffrey Wright as James Gordon.

### Design

#### Sets and props

The production design for "The Batman" was led by James Chinlund, who created a dark and gritty world that was inspired by the comic book series. The film's sets were built in the UK, with some location shooting in the US.

The props and costumes were designed by Jacqueline Durran, who created a distinctive look for each character. The Batsuit was designed to be more practical and functional than previous versions, with a focus on mobility and flexibility.

#### Batsuit

The Batsuit was designed to be a key part of the film's visual identity. The suit was created by Durran and her team, who worked closely with Pattinson to ensure that it was comfortable and practical to wear.

The suit was inspired by the comic book series, with a focus on the character's iconic logo and color scheme. However, the design was also influenced by modern armor and tactical gear, with a focus on functionality and mobility.

#### Other costumes

The costumes for the rest of the cast were designed to reflect their characters' personalities and backgrounds. The Riddler's costume was designed to be a key part of his character's obsessive and meticulous personality, with a focus on detail and precision.

Selina Kyle's costume was designed to reflect her character's cat burglar persona, with a focus on flexibility and mobility. The costume was also designed to be visually striking, with a bold color scheme and distinctive design.

### Filming

Principal photography for "The Batman" began in January 2020 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in the UK and the US, with some studio work in London.

#### Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The production was affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, which caused a delay in filming. The cast and crew had to follow strict protocols to ensure their safety, including social distancing and mask-wearing.

### Editing

The film was edited by William Hoy and Tyler Nelson, who worked closely with Reeves to ensure that the film's pacing and tone were consistent with his vision.

### Visual effects

The visual effects for "The Batman" were created by Weta Digital, who worked closely with Reeves to ensure that the film's visual identity was consistent with his vision. The effects were used to enhance the film's action sequences and to create a sense of scale and scope.

### Music

The score for "The Batman" was composed by Michael Giacchino, who worked closely with Reeves to ensure that the music was consistent with his vision. The score was designed to be dark and gritty, with a focus on percussion and electronics.

Marketing
------------

The marketing campaign for "The Batman" began in August 2020, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer was well-received by fans, who were excited to see the film's dark and gritty take on the Batman character.

The campaign continued over the next few months, with the release of several more trailers and TV spots. The film's social media accounts were also active, with regular updates and behind-the-scenes content.

Release
---------

### Theatrical

"The Batman" was released in theaters on March 4, 2022. The film was released in several formats, including IMAX and Dolby Cinema.

### Home media

The film was released on home media on May 24, 2022. The release included a Blu-ray and DVD version, as well as a digital version.

Reception
------------

### Box office

"The Batman" was a commercial success, grossing over $770 million worldwide. The film was well-received by audiences, who praised its dark and gritty take on the Batman character.

### Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its dark and gritty take on the Batman character. The film's cast, particularly Pattinson and Dano, were praised for their performances.

### Accolades

The film received several awards and nominations, including an Academy Award nomination for Best Cinematography.

Thematic analysis
------------------

### Class conflict and inequality

The film explores themes of class conflict and inequality, particularly in the character of the Riddler. The Riddler's obsession with exposing the corruption and decadence of Gotham City's elite is driven by a sense of class resentment and anger.

### Depiction of Batman

The film's depiction of Batman is notable for its dark and gritty take on the character. The film's Batman is a complex and nuanced character, driven by a sense of trauma and anger. The film's exploration of Batman's psyche is a key part of its narrative, and adds depth and complexity to the character.

Future
---------
